divs: Sighting DetailsDATE: 130315 Time: ~0421 Duration: 1 minute Location: offshore, Hamakua coast off Honomu, Hawaii island, HI 96720 Range: about 3 ��� 5 km Weather: Cloudy, no precipitation within at least an hour b4 and after T = ~18 C. Humidity ~75% Wind: Calm, sight variable breeze Sea: no warnings issued. Sea surface not discernable No Moon Observer: REDACTED State of consciousness: Alert, awake for several hours While standing on the lanai looking eastward out to sea, he sighted an object, resembling a cruise ship, firstly with one row of lights and one solid, one changing light quite above. While focusing on anomaly the row of lights were oscillating, another row of lights appeared under the existing row for approx 25 or 30 seconds, then went out. The object was observed for about 45-55 sec. The observer was alerted when the lights wavered. An additional row illuminated and then shut off, the lights shimmered and wavered, and then the object slid rapidly out of view behind the sugarcane. The observer became excited, and began searching for a video camera, hesitated to awaken his wife, did not rouse her but found the camera. He returned to the lanai and stood on the railing to attempt to see the object again. NOTE: MUFON report forms do not handle sea-based sightings well, nor account for speed changes without course change.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Honomu
This sighting has never been favorited.
Summary: object resembling a cruise ship w/ two rows of lights that wavered, blinked, and shimmered. Anomalous motion.
